Qcircuits.core.Network¶

class Qcircuits.core.Network(netlist)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Network class parses network arrays generated by the GUI or written manually by the user. It allows the computation of an admittance Y of the network between two nodes as well as the voltage transfer function of the network between two ports (4 nodes). Y across an inductor or junction is used to determine the normal-mode frequencies, dissipations and, in conjunction with the transfer function, the zero-point fluctuations of flux (and other variables) between two arbitrary nodes.

netlist : list
list of Component objects

Methods

simplify()

admittance(node_minus, node_plus)[source]¶

Compute the admittance of the network between two nodes node_plus and node_minus by removing all other nodes through star-mesh transformations.

node_minus: integer node_plus: integer

branch_admittance(node_1, node_2)[source]¶

Returns the admittance in the branch connecting node_1 and node_2. If they are not directly connected through a single Component, this function returns 0 (i.e. the admittnce of an open circuit). This function is written to avoid calling try/except clauses repetitivly to verify if self.net_dict[node_1][node_2] is an existing key

node_1: integer node_2: integer

connect(element, node_minus, node_plus)[source]¶

Modifies the net_dict variable such that node_minus and node_plus are marked as connected in future calculations. net_dict is a dictionary such that net_dict[node_A][node_B] gives the non-wire circuit component connecting node_A and node_B. If node_A and node_B are not connected, calling net_dict[node_A][node_B] will raise a KeyError

element: a Circuit object which is not a Wire or a Ground node_minus: integer

negative node of the element
node_plus: integer
positive node of the element
remove_node(node_to_remove)[source]¶

Makes use of the star-mesh transform to remove the node_to_remove from the network. A node $N$=``node_to_remove`` connected to nodes $A,B,C,..$ through impedances $Z_A,Z_B,…$ (the star) can be eliminated if we interconnect nodes $A,B,C,..$ with impedances $Z_{AB},Z_{AC},Z_{BC},…$ given by $Z_{XY} = Z_XZ_Ysum_M1/Z_M$. The resulting network is called the mesh.

node: integer, node to be removed of the network stored in net_dict

transfer(node_left_minus, node_left_plus, node_right_minus, node_right_plus)[source]¶

Returns the transfer function V_right/V_left relating the voltage on a port ‘right’ defined by node_right_minus and node_right_plus and a port ‘left’ defined by node_left_minus and node_left_plus We proceed by constructing an ABCD matrix and returning V_right/V_left = 1/A

node_left_minus: integer node_left_plus: integer node_right_minus: integer node_right_plus: integer
